Full_Sentence: The difficult situation facing Ukraine cannot be resolved through unilateral actions of any sort.

Full_Sentence: As Secretary Kerry said on 17 April, "All of this, we are convinced, represents a good day's work.

Component: [581, 'Over the Easter holiday, Ukraine voluntarily suspended its counter-terrorism initiative, choosing to de-escalate despite its fundamental right to provide security on its own territory and for its own people.']

Component: [583, 'In addition, Prime Minister Yatsenyuk has publicly committed his Government to undertake far-reaching constitutional reforms that will strengthen the power of the regions.']

Component: [584, 'He has appealed personally to Russian-speaking Ukrainians, pledging to support special status for the Russian language and to protect those who use it.']

Component: [585, 'He announced legislation to grant amnesty to those who surrender arms.']

Full_Sentence: All of that should be cause for optimism and hope.
Component: [586, 'All of that should be cause for optimism and hope.']

Full_Sentence: Tragically, what we have seen from Russia since 17 April is exactly what we saw from Russia prior to 17 April: more attempts to stir up trouble, more efforts to undermine the Government of Ukraine and statement after statement at odds with the facts.
Component: [587, 'what we have seen from Russia since 17 April is exactly what we saw from Russia prior to 17 April: more attempts to stir up trouble, more efforts to undermine the Government of Ukraine and statement after statement at odds with the facts.']

Full_Sentence: The truth about what is happening in Ukraine should guide our discussion, because truth is the only foundation on which an equitable and lasting solution to this crisis can be based.

Full_Sentence: China is shocked and grieved by the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17 in eastern Ukraine.

Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence: Our priority now is to establish the facts.

Full_Sentence: Pending that, it is not advisable to jump to any conclusion, make any assumptions or trade accusations.
Component: [1529, 'Pending that, it is not advisable to jump to any conclusion, make any assumptions or trade accusations.']

Full_Sentence: We support the holding of an independent, fair and objective investigation into the incident.

Full_Sentence: We also call on all parties to coordinate and cooperate during the investigation.

Full_Sentence: China is deeply concerned about the situation.

Full_Sentence: We hope that the parties concerned will take into account the well-being of the entire population of Ukraine, focus on maintaining regional peace and stability, stay calm and exercise restraint to prevent the further escalation of the conflict and confrontation.

Full_Sentence: A political solution is the only way out.

Full_Sentence: The Ukrainian armed forces have responded firmly to those attacks.

Full_Sentence: They has every right to restore law and order, and they have underlined their commitment to do so in proportionate manner.

Full_Sentence: Russia has a crucial role to play in de-escalating this persistently dangerous crisis.
Component: [1565, 'Russia has a crucial role to play in de-escalating this persistently dangerous crisis.']

Full_Sentence: It must end its provocations and any support for separatist forces.
Component: [1566, 'It must end its provocations and any support for separatist forces.']

Full_Sentence: It must control its border with Ukraine and prevent the flow of weapons, equipment and fighters from Russia into Ukraine.
Component: [1567, 'It must control its border with Ukraine and prevent the flow of weapons, equipment and fighters from Russia into Ukraine.']

Full_Sentence: Russia must withdraw the large number of troops it has again amassed on the Ukrainian border.
Component: [1568, 'Russia must withdraw the large number of troops it has again amassed on the Ukrainian border.']

Full_Sentence: It must actively work to de-escalate tensions and use its considerable influence with separatist groups in Ukraine to that end.

Full_Sentence: Further political efforts are essential.
Component: [1570, 'Further political efforts are essential.']

Full_Sentence: The four-party talks in Berlin in the past two weeks showed some promise.

Full_Sentence: At the start ofmy remarks, Iwish to express, on behalf of the Government and the people of Luxembourg, my most sincere condolences to the families and relatives of the 298 people aboard the Malaysia Airlines aircraft that crashed yesterday afternoon near the village of Grabovo in eastern Ukraine.

Full_Sentence: Among the victims was a Dutch-English family living in Luxembourg.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence: Our sympathy also goes out to the Governments and the peoples of the Netherlands, Malaysia, Germany, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Indonesia, New Zealand, the Philippines and the United Kingdom.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence: The international community owes it to the victims to shed light on the circumstances that led to this tragic event.
Component: [1578, 'The international community owes it to the victims to shed light on the circumstances that led to this tragic event.']

Full_Sentence: A transparent and independent comprehensive international investigation must be completed as soon as possible.
Component: [1579, 'A transparent and independent comprehensive international investigation must be completed as soon as possible.']

Full_Sentence: All parties involved should fully cooperate to that end.

Full_Sentence: We commend the Ukrainian authorities in that regard.

Full_Sentence: Those who committed this heinous act must be held accountable.
Component: [1583, 'Those who committed this heinous act must be held accountable.']

Full_Sentence: This air disaster took place in a context of the ongoing deterioration of the situation in the east of Ukraine.
Component: [1584, 'This air disaster took place in a context of the ongoing deterioration of the situation in the east of Ukraine.']

Full_Sentence: Day after day, we receive reports of civilians killed in fighting between the Ukrainian armed forces and illegal armed groups.

Full_Sentence: The living conditions ofpeople living in areas affected by the hostilities continue to deteriorate, and the number of internally displaced persons has steadily increased.

Full_Sentence: The escalation of violence in recent days, until its tragic climax yesterday, demonstrates once again that active armed groups in eastern Ukraine are actually well-equipped and well-trained paramilitary forces who enjoy clear external support.

Full_Sentence: We urge the Russian Federation to actively use its influence on the illegal armed groups and ensure that weapons and fighters can no longer cross the border, in order to bring about a de-escalation as soon as possible.

Full_Sentence: Throughout the past few months, Ukraine has demonstrated its commitment to finding a peaceful solution to the crisis and to implementing the agreements concluded, in particular the joint declaration adopted on 17 April in Geneva between Ukraine, Russia, the European Union and the United States.

political and human rights situation in Ukraine.

conflict in Ukraine since February.
Component: non-arg

[2125, 'In the intervening
months more than 3,700 people have been killed, more

Power (United States of America): I thank

the ongoing crisis in Ukraine.

Full_Sentence:

Secretary-General Toyberg-Frandzen for his clear and
objective briefing.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:

Apakan and Tagliavini for briefing us today and for the
brave and critically important role that the Organization
for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) is
continuing to play on the ground.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
This is the Security Council's twenty-sixth meeting
on the current crisis in Ukraine.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
If our message and the
message of other countries today on the deteriorating
situation in eastern Ukraine sounds familiar, it is
for good reason.

Full_Sentence:
For while the situation has evolved,
the root of the problem remains the same: Russia's
flagrant violation of Ukraine's sovereignty and
territorial integrity.

Full_Sentence:

subsequently offered explanations to the Council that it
knows are untrue.

commitments and then failed to live up to them, and
subsequently offered explanations to the Council that it

the restoration of Ukrainian control of its side of the
international border, OSCE monitoring of the border
and a security zone on either side of the border, as well
as the withdrawal of foreign forces, mercenaries and
equipment from Ukraine and the release of hostages
and prisoners.

We reiterate

peace agreements will only further exacerbate violence
and instability and bring about a worsening of the

Any

Full_Sentence:
The
shared challenges have to be tackled by all Ukrainians

shared challenges have to be tackled by all Ukrainians
across the board, be they in the east or the west of the

I am referring to the political reforms, national

Those shared
challenges and can be tackled only through cooperation

challenges and can be tackled only through cooperation
among all the parties so as to ensure that the conflict

We therefore

encourage the Government to continue its efforts to

We stress the importance of cooperation among all

Full_Sentence:

interim for Political Affairs, Mr. Jens Anders Toyberg-
Frandzen, for his briefing.

Full_Sentence:

for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE)
Special Monitoring Mission, and Ambassador Heidi
Tagliavini, representative of the OSCE Chairperson-in-
Office, for making themselves available to us and for
the invaluable information they have provided to the
Council on the critical situation in Ukraine.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
Luxembourg fully supports the efforts of the
Swiss Chairman-in-Office of the OSCE to find a
political solution to the crisis, while fully upholding the
sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
Component:
[2523, 'Luxembourg fully supports the efforts of the
Swiss Chairman-in-Office of the OSCE to find a
political solution to the crisis, while fully upholding the
sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine.']

Full_Sentence:

support the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission, which

[2524, 'We also
support the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission, which
has a key role to play to promote the de-escalation of
tensions by providing objective information on the
situation on the ground.']

Full_Sentence:
We are very concerned by the serious deterioration
of the situation in eastern Ukraine since 2 November,
when the separatists held illegal elections in the regions
of the Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts under their control.

[2525, 'We are very concerned by the serious deterioration
of the situation in eastern Ukraine since 2 November,
when the separatists held illegal elections in the regions
of the Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts under their control.']

Full_Sentence:
While the Minsk protocol and memorandum, signed on
5 and 19 September, respectively, paved the way for a
peaceful end to the conflict, non-compliance with key
provisions of the Minsk agreements has led to a new
escalation of tensions and a worsening situation in
several regions of eastern Ukraine.
Component: [2526, 'While the Minsk protocol and memorandum, signed on\n5 and 19 September, respectively, paved the way for a\npeaceful end to the conflict,']

Full_Sentence:

5 and 19 September, respectively, paved the way for a
peaceful end to the conflict, non-compliance with key
provisions of the Minsk agreements has led to a new
escalation of tensions and a worsening situation in

provisions of the Minsk agreements has led to a new

We are concerned about the recent
build-up of Russian troops in the immediate proximity
of the Ukrainian border.

positions.

[2530, 'We are also concerned
about the increased movements of military convoy in
separatist-controlled areas heading for Ukrainian army
positions.']

large convoys of military trucks without license plates

howitzers.
Component:
[2531, 'As has been noted, in recent days the OSCE
Special Monitoring Mission has reported sightings of
large convoys of military trucks without license plates
transporting troops and heavy weapons, including
howitzers.']

A convoy of nine tanks - four T-72s and

on Saturday, 8 November.
Component: [2532, 'A convoy of nine tanks - four T-72s and\nfive T-64s - heading west was observed by the Mission\non Saturday, 8 November.']

These movements of troops
and heavy weaponry are accompanied by intensified

Full_Sentence:
We condemn the sham elections held on 2 November
in the eastern regions of Ukraine controlled by the
separatists, with the blessing of Russia.
Component: [2534, 'We condemn the sham elections held on 2 November\nin the eastern regions of Ukraine controlled by the\nseparatists, with the blessing of Russia.']

We do not
recognize those elections.
Component: [2535, 'We do not\nrecognize those elections.']

Full_Sentence:
They are illegal under the
Constitution and Ukrainian law.
Component: [2536, 'They are illegal under the\nConstitution and Ukrainian law.']

Full_Sentence:
They constitute a
flagrant violation of the commitments that Russia and

signing the Minsk protocol.
Component:
[2537, 'They constitute a
flagrant violation of the commitments that Russia and
the representatives of illegal armed groups made when
signing the Minsk protocol.']

Those sham elections do

not legitimize the warlords at the head of the self-

Successive reports of the Special Monitoring Mission

[2539, 'Successive reports of the Special Monitoring Mission
bear witness to serious violations of human rights

separatist groups.']

Full_Sentence:
These individuals cannot claim to
speak for the people of Donbas.

[2541, 'The Secretary-General
and the OSCE Chairperson-in-Office have rightly

Full_Sentence:
We welcome the concrete steps taken by Ukraine to

[2542, 'We welcome the concrete steps taken by Ukraine to
meet its commitments under the Minsk agreements, in

Full_Sentence:
In addition

Component:
[2543, 'of particular
importance is the withdrawal of armed groups, military
equipment, combatants and illegal mercenaries, as well

its permanent monitoring with OSCE verification.']

It is

Component:
[2544, "It is
crucial in this context that the Mission's monitoring of
the border posts at Gukovo and Donetsk be extended to
other border-crossing areas as soon as possible."]

Full_Sentence:
It becomes more urgent every day to end the
conflict impacting Ukraine.
Component: [2545, 'It becomes more urgent every day to end the\nconflict impacting Ukraine.']

Full_Sentence:
The conflict has already
killed more than 4,000 people since April.
Component: [2546, 'The conflict has already\nkilled more than 4,000 people since April.']

in Donetsk.

[2547, 'The victims
include numerous children, including two struck down
on 5 November by mortar shells on a school playing field
in Donetsk.']

The solution to the

support of the OSCE.

Full_Sentence:

conflict has been identified; it includes the good-faith
implementation of the Minsk protocol of 5 September
and the Minsk memorandum of 19 September, signed by
all parties to the conflict, with the decisive verification
support of the OSCE.

Ukraine has demonstrated in deed its determination

We call on the separatists
and Russia to do the same so as to halt the spiral
of conflict.
Component: [2552, 'We call on the separatists\nand Russia to do the same so as to halt the spiral\nof conflict.']

Full_Sentence:
We call on the Russian Federation to
shoulder its responsibilities in the full and complete
implementation of the Minsk agreements by preventing
all military movement of weapons or combatants from

have subscribed under the Minsk agreements.

Full_Sentence:
Mr. Oh Joon (Republic of Korea): I would like
to thank Mr. Toyberg-Frandzen, Ambassador Apakan
and Ambassador Tagliavini for their briefings on the
situation in eastern Ukraine.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We are acutely alarmed by the observations
reported by the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission,
detailing the influx of military equipment, weapons
and armed personnel into the region of Ukraine held
by armed rebel groups.
Component:
[2554, 'We are acutely alarmed by the observations
reported by the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission,
detailing the influx of military equipment, weapons
and armed personnel into the region of Ukraine held
by armed rebel groups.']

Full_Sentence:
It represents a clear violation
of the Minsk agreements, a serious encroachment on
the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine,
and a challenge to the future of the country.
Component:
[2555, 'It represents a clear violation
of the Minsk agreements, a serious encroachment on
the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine,
and a challenge to the future of the country.']

Full_Sentence:
The Minsk
protocol and memorandum of September offered the
basis for hope towards a peaceful and viable resolution
of the crisis.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
They provided the parties concerned with
a measure of political space to build upon.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
However,
such early hopes have turned into worries that the
conflict may again escalate.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
The withdrawal of foreign
troops and military equipment under OSCE monitoring

be fully implemented.
Component:
[2556, 'The withdrawal of foreign
troops and military equipment under OSCE monitoring
is an integral part of the Minsk agreements, which must
be fully implemented.']

Full_Sentence:
We urge all concerned parties to
stop any provocative actions that may derail the fragile
peace process, as embodied in the Minsk agreements.
Component: [2557, 'We urge all concerned parties to\nstop any provocative actions that may derail the fragile\npeace process, as embodied in the Minsk agreements.']

Full_Sentence:
All outside military intervention in the situation must
cease immediately.
Component: [2558, 'All outside military intervention in the situation must\ncease immediately.']

Full_Sentence:
Regarding political developments in the country,
we welcome the holding of parliamentary elections on
26 October, which proved to be orderly and peaceful.
Component: [2559, 'Regarding political developments in the country,\nwe welcome the holding of parliamentary elections on\n26 October']

Full_Sentence:
Regarding political developments in the country,
we welcome the holding of parliamentary elections on
26 October, which proved to be orderly and peaceful.
Component: [2560, 'which proved to be orderly and peaceful.']

Full_Sentence:
We very much hope that the election results, together
with national reconciliation and a process of dialogue,
will pave the way for much needed stability throughout
the country.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
In that regard, the separate elections held
by armed rebel groups in eastern Ukraine earlier this
month run counter to the spirit of a dialogue-based
resolution of the situation.
Component:
[2561, 'In that regard, the separate elections held
by armed rebel groups in eastern Ukraine earlier this
month run counter to the spirit of a dialogue-based
resolution of the situation.']

Full_Sentence:
They also undermine
the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine.
Component: [2562, 'They also undermine\nthe sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine.']

Full_Sentence:
We hope that the political track based on the Minsk
agreements can be restored and put back into force as
soon as possible.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We commend the role of OSCE, the United Nations
and other partners in seeking a peaceful political
resolution of the situation, and we stand ready to
support such efforts.
Component:
[2563, 'We commend the role of OSCE, the United Nations
and other partners in seeking a peaceful political
resolution of the situation, and we stand ready to
support such efforts.']

Full_Sentence:
Sir Mark Lyall Grant (United Kingdom): I thank
the three briefers for their briefings this afternoon.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
As others have pointed out, the Council has met
many times on Ukraine over the past six months.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
There
is a reason for that.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
The situation in Ukraine continues
to be a severe threat and indeed an escalating threat
to international peace and security.
Component: [2564, 'The situation in Ukraine continues\nto be a severe threat and indeed an escalating threat\nto international peace and security.']

Full_Sentence:
There is a reason
why that is so.
Component: [2565, 'There is a reason\nwhy that is so.']

Full_Sentence:
Since the start of the crisis, Russian
actions have been consistently designed to undermine,
interfere with and transgress Ukraine's sovereignty and
territorial integrity in a way that flouts international
norms, including the Charter of the United Nations.
Component:
[2566, "Since the start of the crisis, Russian
actions have been consistently designed to undermine,
interfere with and transgress Ukraine's sovereignty and
territorial integrity in a way that flouts international
norms, including the Charter of the United Nations."]

Since the Council last met on 24 October to discuss
Ukraine (see S/PV.7287), Russia and the separatists
it supports have repeatedly undermined and ignored
the Minsk agreements.
Component:
[2567, 'Since the Council last met on 24 October to discuss
Ukraine (see S/PV.7287), Russia and the separatists
it supports have repeatedly undermined and ignored
the Minsk agreements.']

Full_Sentence:
Russian leaders have told us
one thing and then ordered their military, their special
forces and their separatist rebel proxies to do another.
Component: [2568, 'Russian leaders have told us\none thing and then ordered their military, their special\nforces and their separatist rebel proxies to do another.']

Full_Sentence: The ceasefire has been breached.
Component: [2569, 'The ceasefire has been breached.']

Full_Sentence:
Attempts to monitor
and verify the ceasefire and the border have been
blocked.
Component: [2570, 'Attempts to monitor\nand verify the ceasefire and the border have been\nblocked.']

Full_Sentence:
Russia continues to supply its soldiers in
Ukraine and the separatists they fight alongside with
heavy weaponry, artillery, tanks and armoured vehicles

Component:
[2571, 'Russia continues to supply its soldiers in
Ukraine and the separatists they fight alongside with
heavy weaponry, artillery, tanks and armoured vehicles
in flagrant breach of the Minsk protocols.']

Organization for Security and Cooperation in
Europe (OSCE) reporting in recent days lays bare the
extent of that Russian support.
Component: [2572, 'Organization for Security and Cooperation in\nEurope (OSCE) reporting in recent days lays bare the\nextent of that Russian support.']

Full_Sentence:
On several separate
occasions, the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission has
witnessed significant numbers of troops and military
equipment moving in convoy in separatist-held areas.
Component:
[2573, 'On several separate
occasions, the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission has
witnessed significant numbers of troops and military
equipment moving in convoy in separatist-held areas.']

Full_Sentence:
I
will mention just one such report.
Component: [2574, 'I\nwill mention just one such report.']

Full_Sentence:
On 8 November, the
Mission observed a convoy of more than 40 unmarked
military vehicles moving west on the outskirts of
Donetsk.
Component:
[2575, 'On 8 November, the
Mission observed a convoy of more than 40 unmarked
military vehicles moving west on the outskirts of
Donetsk.']

Full_Sentence:
It included 19 unmarked Kamaz trucks,
each towing a howitzer artillery piece and carrying
personnel in green uniforms without insignia; 15
Kraz troop carriers; 6 fuel tankers; and an unmarked
Bronetransporter armoured personnel carrier.
Component:
[2576, 'It included 19 unmarked Kamaz trucks,
each towing a howitzer artillery piece and carrying
personnel in green uniforms without insignia; 15
Kraz troop carriers; 6 fuel tankers; and an unmarked
Bronetransporter armoured personnel carrier.']

Full_Sentence:
We
have seen this pattern before - unmarked columns of
military vehicles entering Ukraine to support continued
fighting by separatists.
Component:
[2577, 'We
have seen this pattern before - unmarked columns of
military vehicles entering Ukraine to support continued
fighting by separatists.']

Full_Sentence:
Efforts to remove markings
and insignia from those vehicles cannot disguise the
fact that they come from Russia.
Component: [2578, 'Efforts to remove markings\nand insignia from those vehicles cannot disguise the\nfact that they come from Russia.']

Full_Sentence:
What other credible
explanation is there?
Component: [2579, 'What other credible\nexplanation is there?']

Full_Sentence:
Yet Russia continues to deny that fact, despite
the fact that its attempts at deception turned to farce
only yesterday when Russian television station NTV
broadcast footage of an armoured personnel carrier
at the head of a column in Donetsk bearing markings
from the Russian city of Ryazan.
Component: [2580, 'Yet Russia continues to deny that fact']

Full_Sentence:
Yet Russia continues to deny that fact, despite
the fact that its attempts at deception turned to farce
only yesterday when Russian television station NTV
broadcast footage of an armoured personnel carrier
at the head of a column in Donetsk bearing markings

supplying separatists across the border, then why does
it continue to block any expansion of OSCE border

Russia must implement the commitment
it made at Minsk to allow the monitoring of its border

[2583, 'Russia must implement the commitment
it made at Minsk to allow the monitoring of its border
with Ukraine, of which only 2 kilometres are currently
observed by the OSCE.']

OSCE reports that

commitment towards the Minsk agreements of those
who control that territory and their Russian supporters.
Component:
[2585, 'OSCE reports that
UAVs are being jammed electronically by military-
grade equipment call into question the credibility of the
commitment towards the Minsk agreements of those
who control that territory and their Russian supporters.']

Full_Sentence:
The United Kingdom deeply regrets that illegal

Donetsk and Luhansk on 2 November.
Component: [2586, 'The United Kingdom deeply regrets that illegal\nelections took place in separatist-controlled areas of\nDonetsk and Luhansk on 2 November.']

law and seriously undermined the Minsk protocol.

[2587, 'The Secretary-
General could not have been clearer in his public
message that the elections were illegal under Ukrainian
law and seriously undermined the Minsk protocol.']

Chairperson-in-Office of the OSCE was equally clear

Component:
[2588, 'The
Chairperson-in-Office of the OSCE was equally clear
that the elections ran counter to the letter and spirit of
the Minsk protocol and would further complicate its
implementation.']

When the leadership of international organizations
to which Russia belongs issue such statements, one
would expect Russia to listen.
Component: [2589, 'When the leadership of international organizations\nto which Russia belongs issue such statements, one\nwould expect Russia to listen.']

offered support to the elections.
Component: [2590, 'Russia has\noffered support to the elections.']

Full_Sentence:
Russia has said that
it will respect the will of the citizens of the Donbas

it will respect the will of the citizens of the Donbas

the Ukrainian parliamentary elections of October 26
represent a new phase in the process of democratization

The forward

steps must now be translated into the implementation of

Europe gave a clear alternative -

ceasefire be fully respected, monitored and verified by

Full_Sentence:
We must now
turn to dialogue and seriously discuss the future of
Ukraine and how to restore peace.

Full_Sentence:
We also call on
Russia to stop supporting the separatists, who are hell-
bent on destabilizing the situation.
Component: [3660, 'We also call on\nRussia to stop supporting the separatists, who are hell-\nbent on destabilizing the situation']

Full_Sentence:
We call for a long-
overdue end to the transfer of weapons and manpower
across the Russian-Ukrainian border, which is fuelling
the war and violates the territorial integrity of Ukraine
and the most fundamental principles of the Charter of
the United Nations, and which undermines diplomatic
efforts seeking to settle the conflict in accordance
with international law and the fundamental rights and
freedoms of all Ukrainians, including its minorities.
Component: [3661, 'We call for a long-\noverdue end to the transfer of weapons and manpower\nacross the Russian-Ukrainian border']

We
urge Russia to use all its influence on the separatists in

[3664, 'We
urge Russia to use all its influence on the separatists in

Full_Sentence:
The statements made by Mr. Lavrov today,
announcing the facilitation of contacts between
the warring parties, are a positive sign but they are
not enough.
Component: [3665, 'the facilitation of contacts between\nthe warring parties, are a positive sign but they are\nnot enough.']

Full_Sentence:
We also call on Ukraine to begin the
institutional reform as per its commitments.
Component: [3666, 'We also call on Ukraine to begin the\ninstitutional reform as per its commitments.']

Full_Sentence:
President
Poroshenko has spoken publicly of the prospects
for national dialogue and institutional reform.
Component: [3667, 'President\nPoroshenko has spoken publicly of the prospects\nfor national dialogue and institutional reform.']

Full_Sentence:
That
statement was a further step towards the comprehensive
implementation of the Minsk accords, which are the
only way to achieve a negotiated solution to this crisis.
Component:
[3668, 'That
statement was a further step towards the comprehensive
implementation of the Minsk accords, which are the
only way to achieve a negotiated solution to this crisis.']

Full_Sentence:
The international community will judge the good faith
of the parties not on mere statements but on concrete and
verifiable actions that prove their genuine commitment
to de-escalation.
Component:
[3669, 'The international community will judge the good faith
of the parties not on mere statements but on concrete and
verifiable actions that prove their genuine commitment
to de-escalation.']

Full_Sentence:
We must also call on all parties to refrain from
attacking the civilian population, to respect international
humanitarian law and to ensure humanitarian access to
the wounded and to civilians in need of assistance.
Component:
[3670, 'We must also call on all parties to refrain from
attacking the civilian population, to respect international
humanitarian law and to ensure humanitarian access to
the wounded and to civilians in need of assistance.']

Full_Sentence:
We
must underscore that there can be no military solution
to this conflict.
Component: [3671, 'We\nmust underscore that there can be no military solution\nto this conflict.']

Full_Sentence:
Only by all parties fully implementing
the Minsk accords and resuming serious diplomatic
discussions, in the context of the trilateral contact
group, can there be a positive outcome to this crisis.
Component: [3672, 'Only by all parties fully implementing\nthe Minsk accords and resuming serious diplomatic\ndiscussions']

Full_Sentence:
Only by all parties fully implementing
the Minsk accords and resuming serious diplomatic
discussions, in the context of the trilateral contact
group, can there be a positive outcome to this crisis.
Component: [3673, 'can there be a positive outcome to this crisis.']

Full_Sentence: Every efforts must be made to that end.
Component: [3674, 'Every efforts must be made to that end.']

Full_Sentence:
In this difficult context, we cannot afford to let
down our guard.
Component: [3675, 'In this difficult context, we cannot afford to let\ndown our guard.']

Full_Sentence:
France remains and will remain
fully mobilized to achieving a peaceful settlement.
Component: [3676, 'France remains and will remain\nfully mobilized to achieving a peaceful settlement.']

Full_Sentence:
Our goals are clear and consistent: respect for the
ceasefire, the withdrawal of heavy weaponry on each
side of the contact line, a resumption of prisoner
exchanges, the resolution of humanitarian issues and
the implementation by the parties of all measures under
the Minsk accords.

Full_Sentence:
France will pursue its efforts, in close contact with
our German partners and the Russian and Ukrainian
authorities, under the so-called Normandy format.

Full_Sentence: We have no time to waste.
Component: [3679, 'We have no time to waste.']

Full_Sentence:
This is not the time for
prevarication or hypocrisy.
Component: [3680, 'This is not the time for\nprevarication or hypocrisy.']

Full_Sentence:
Today we must urgently
end this conflict, which has already claimed more than
5,000 lives and exacted too high a price from Ukraine,
from Russia, from the European Union and from the
international system as a whole.
Component: [3681, 'Today we must urgently\nend this conflict']

Today we must urgently

Ukraine has a democratic Constitution and is

Ukraine made

Full_Sentence:
Given
these facts, there should be no violence in Ukraine.

Full_Sentence:
However, today we are meeting once again due to an
extremely serious deterioration in the situation.

Full_Sentence:
Spain would have liked the Council to adopt a
statement.

I

therefore vigorously and unreservedly condemn the

We call once again for the full implementation of

immediate restoration of the ceasefire.

Full_Sentence:
We appeal to
all those in a position to influence those responsible
for their horrendous acts, in particular to Russia, to,
in accordance with its status as a signatory to the

21 January, as well as a member of the OSCE trilateral

and compel the rebel groups to renounce violence and
accept the peaceful and lawful path to pursue their
claims.

accords.

casualties among civilians, including women and
children.

or confrontation.

called on the parties to the conflict to take effective
measures to as to avoid any escalation of the conflict

Full_Sentence:
What is most

September.

objectives.

Full_Sentence:
Current developments in the situation clearly
demonstrate that in dealing with the situation in
Ukraine, it is necessary to abide by the overall objective
of seeking a political settlement; to fully consider
the complex historical factors and the reality of the
issue relating to Ukraine; to take into full account the
legitimate rights, interests and demands of all regions
and ethnic communities in Ukraine; and to attach great
importance to addressing the legitimate concerns of
all parties and ensure that the interests of all sides are
accommodated in a balanced manner, so as to arrive at
a fundamental and enduring solution to the question of
Ukraine.

the consequences.

which left 30 people dead and more than 100 injured,
including women and children, serve to illustrate
this point.

[3732, 'The rocket attacks on Mariupol,
which left 30 people dead and more than 100 injured,

They serve
no military purpose, they violate international law and

We call on both sides to immediately de-escalate
the fighting and respect the terms of the ceasefire
agreement reached at the Minsk peace talks.

We stress

The parties should seek a political solution

It is important that the concerns of

a negotiated political settlement.

Mr. President, for convening this Security Council
briefing on Ukraine.

and we appreciate the information he has provided to us
on the political situation in Ukraine.

which has caused loss of civilian lives and untold
numbers of injuries.

Venezuela reiterates its call on
the parties to promote a peaceful, negotiated, political
solution to the crisis.

We stress that any violent incident
on the ground should be investigated independently,
and that the investigation's conclusions should be based
on irrefutable evidence.

on the ground should be investigated independently,
and that the investigation's conclusions should be based
on irrefutable evidence."]

Venezuela rejects any act of

The intensification of the armed conflict in eastern
Ukraine makes it imperative that the parties put an end

Full_Sentence:
The intensification of the armed conflict in eastern

to their hostilities in the area.

The ceasefire is therefore
a crucial step.

Full_Sentence:
It is necessary to continue on the path of seeking a
political and diplomatic solution to the Ukrainian crisis,
in which the conflicting parties commit to working on
achieving a firm and lasting peace.

political and diplomatic solution to the Ukrainian crisis,
in which the conflicting parties commit to working on

The mediation efforts by regional organizations

In that

Germany and France to promote dialogue among
Ukraine, Russia and the representatives of the Donbas
region.

Full_Sentence:

and we encourage the parties to work together for its

Component: [3749, 'we encourage the parties to work together for its\nimplementation.']

Full_Sentence:
The Minsk agreements are the basis on which
lasting peace can be achieved in the region.
Component: [3750, 'The Minsk agreements are the basis on which\nlasting peace can be achieved in the region.']

agreement between the parties should be avoided.

the peace process.

Full_Sentence:
The cycle of violence must be
broken.

war propaganda.

Full_Sentence:
The historic and root causes of the
conflict must be addressed and a political agreement
between the parties must be sought.
Component: [3755, 'The historic and root causes of the\nconflict must be addressed and a political agreement\nbetween the parties must be sought.']

Full_Sentence:
The escalation in hostilities requires strict
compliance by the belligerent parties with obligations
concerning the protection of civilians in the areas
affected by violence, including the need to ensure
humanitarian access to internally displaced persons,
refugees and others residents in areas affected by the
conflict.

conflict.']

Full_Sentence:
Finally, we again call on all parties to redouble
their efforts in the search for a just and lasting political
solution, which is in their own interests and those of the
entire region.
Component:
[3757, 'Finally, we again call on all parties to redouble

solution, which is in their own interests and those of the

Full_Sentence:

more so because of the failure of the Security Council

Mariupol.

his briefing, which has been very helpful to the Council.

24 January in Mariupol.

The reports of indiscriminate
shelling of civilian populations and residential areas are
deeply concerning, as indeed are the other incidents that
were outlined by Under-Secretary-General Feltman.

[3759, 'The reports of indiscriminate
shelling of civilian populations and residential areas are
deeply concerning, as indeed are the other incidents that

The Mariupol incident
confirms that the situation in eastern Ukraine is now
on a disastrous downward spiral.
Component: [3760, 'The Mariupol incident\nconfirms that the situation in eastern Ukraine is now\non a disastrous downward spiral.']

We do not take this
incident in isolation.
Component: [3761, 'We do not take this\nincident in isolation.']

Its occurrence, magnitude and
the claims made about it by the separatist leadership
speak for themselves.

It was a major assault on a
civilian population with the sole purpose of taking and
controlling the area as a result.
Component: [3763, 'It was a major assault on a\ncivilian population with the sole purpose of taking and\ncontrolling the area as a result.']

Full_Sentence:
The most recent civilian casualties from the conflict
in eastern Ukraine are completely unacceptable.
Component: [3764, 'The most recent civilian casualties from the conflict\nin eastern Ukraine are completely unacceptable.']

Full_Sentence:
We
call on all sides to respect international humanitarian
law and to refrain from any indiscriminate attacks.
Component: [3765, 'We\ncall on all sides to respect international humanitarian\nlaw and to refrain from any indiscriminate attacks.']

In
that regard, we note that rockets have been launched

Full_Sentence:
There can be no
impunity for such reckless acts.
Component: [3767, 'There can be no\nimpunity for such reckless acts.']

Full_Sentence:
Those responsible must
be held accountable for their actions.
Component: [3768, 'Those responsible must\nbe held accountable for their actions.']

Russia's provision of troops and materiel to

the separatists is irresponsible.

the separatists is irresponsible."]

The threat of a

Against the mounting body of evidence, Russia

the separatists.

Full_Sentence:
We support the promotion of a fully inclusive

We call on Russia, instead of

That ceasefire, as already agreed on in the

The Council must also live up to its responsibilities

We must put

politics aside, difficult although that may be, and use

Although

Particular attention

We think that would be quite timely, following

I conclude my statement by recalling the common

Whether it be in the field or in

Like the United Nations, the OSCE was founded
on the principles of dialogue and respect for peace and
stability.

Together, the two organizations are therefore

Full_Sentence:
Sadly, as the Council well knows, that system is

and security, and in doing so to uphold the Charter of
the United Nations and the Helsinki principles.

Full_Sentence:
Sadly, as the Council well knows, that system is
seldom left unchallenged, so it is incumbent upon both

to the continuing crisis in Ukraine.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
At the outset, I
wish to reaffirm the United Kingdom's full support for

integrity and our commitment to the return of Crimea to

[3929, "I
wish to reaffirm the United Kingdom's full support for

and the Trilateral Contact Group.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
One year since our previous meeting on the OSCE

(see S/PV.7391), can we really say that the overall

border.

of the ceasefire, the use of heavy weapons and the

To that list one can now add the unacceptable
aggression directed against OSCE monitors.
Component: [3932, 'To that list one can now add the unacceptable\naggression directed against OSCE monitors.']

Full_Sentence:
I am

we seem no closer to a resolution of the crisis.
Component: [3933, 'I am\nsaddened and deeply worried to say that, one year later,\nwe seem no closer to a resolution of the crisis.']

Since

assistance.
Component:
[3934, 'Since
the crisis began, over 9,000 people have lost their lives,
and over 3 million are now in need of humanitarian
assistance.']

Full_Sentence:
It is clear that that toll will only continue to

and all sides meet their Minsk commitments in full.
Component: [3935, 'It is clear that that toll will only continue to\ngrow unless a truly sustainable ceasefire is put in place\nand all sides meet their Minsk commitments in full.']

Full_Sentence:
To
that end, three clear steps must be taken.
Component: [3936, 'To\nthat end, three clear steps must be taken.']

Full_Sentence:
First, it is imperative that the Monitoring Mission,
ably directed by Ambassador Apakan, be permitted to
carry out its mandate in full.
Component: [3937, 'First, it is imperative that the Monitoring Mission,\nably directed by Ambassador Apakan, be permitted to\ncarry out its mandate in full.']

Full_Sentence:
The threats and aggressive
behaviour towards monitors must end.
Component: [3938, 'The threats and aggressive\nbehaviour towards monitors must end.']

Full_Sentence:
The Mission
must have unrestricted access to all of Ukraine,
especially those parts of the border with Russia not
under Ukraine's control.
Component:
[3939, "The Mission
must have unrestricted access to all of Ukraine,
especially those parts of the border with Russia not
under Ukraine's control."]

Full_Sentence:
The Russian Federation should
use its influence on the separatists to ensure that that
happens without delay, as they it is obliged to do.
Component: [3940, 'The Russian Federation should\nuse its influence on the separatists to ensure that that\nhappens without delay, as they it is obliged to do.']

Full_Sentence:
Secondly, while there have been some welcome
exchanges of prisoners over the last year, at least 134
Ukrainian prisoners remain in detention.
Component: [3941, 'Secondly, while there have been some welcome\nexchanges of prisoners over the last year, at least 134\nUkrainian prisoners remain in detention.']

Full_Sentence:
We again call

citizens, including those held in Russia and in the

[3942, 'We again call
on Russia to release all illegally detained Ukrainian
citizens, including those held in Russia and in the

Nadiya Savchenko and Oleg Sentsov.

Full_Sentence:
We also reiterate

[3944, 'We also reiterate
that all hostages and illegally detained persons related
to the crisis in and around Ukraine must be released, as

Full_Sentence:
Thirdly, even more important, what is most needed

Component: [3945, 'Thirdly, even more important, what is most needed\nis a truly sustainable ceasefire and genuine political\nwill to restore Ukrainian sovereignty.']

Full_Sentence:
The Russian

to its international commitments.
Component: [3946, 'The Russian\nFederation must demonstrate that will and live up\nto its international commitments.']

Full_Sentence:
It must withdraw
its weapons and personnel and use its considerable

[3947, 'It must withdraw
its weapons and personnel and use its considerable
influence over the separatists to bring an end to the

Full_Sentence:
That is

[3948, 'That is
the best way to end the fear and suffering of ordinary

Until those steps are taken, we will be working

Component: [3949, 'we will be working\nwith our European Union partners to ensure that\nsanctions remain in place.']

Full_Sentence:
The onus is on Russia to

[3950, 'The onus is on Russia to
demonstrate a clear commitment to act in line with the

Full_Sentence:
Those include protecting

We need dialogue based on respect for, and

Without that

Russian actions in Ukraine cast

Full_Sentence:
Mr. Gaspar Martins (Angola): We welcome His
Excellency Mr. Frank-Walter Steinmeier, Minister
for Foreign Affairs of Germany, and thank him for
the very clear and comprehensive briefing delivered
to the Security Council this morning in his role as
Chairperson-in-Office of the Organization for Security
and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE).
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
The priorities set for the German
chairmanship - renewing dialogue, rebuilding trust
and restoring security - address fundamental concerns
of international life and our quest for peace and security.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
Since its inception, the OSCE's work has been a relevant
factor in that endeavour, and we commend its tangible
contribution to international peace and security, its
upholding of the purposes and principles of the United
Nations and its cooperation under Chapter VIII of the
Charter of the United Nations.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
During the 40 years of
its existence, the OSCE's agenda has been effectively
aligned with the three pillars of the United Nations, that
is, peace and security, human rights and development.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
Angola needs a Europe in peace, marked by
stability and growing economies.
Component: [3957, 'Angola needs a Europe in peace, marked by\nstability and growing economies.']

Full_Sentence:
We therefore attach
great relevance to the programme set by the German
chairmanship of the OSCE, focused on the fight
against threats such as terrorism, radicalism, drug
trafficking, as well as on countering the abuse of
cyberspace, by addressing youth radicalization through
a comprehensive approach to security and the efforts
that it has been deploying to address today's growing
security challenges.
Component:
[3958, "We therefore attach
great relevance to the programme set by the German
chairmanship of the OSCE, focused on the fight
against threats such as terrorism, radicalism, drug
trafficking, as well as on countering the abuse of
cyberspace, by addressing youth radicalization through
a comprehensive approach to security and the efforts
that it has been deploying to address today's growing
security challenges."]

Full_Sentence:
Angola supports and appreciates
the OSCE's outstanding role in that regard.
Component: [3959, "Angola supports and appreciates\nthe OSCE's outstanding role in that regard."]

Full_Sentence:
In addition, the organization's efforts to strengthen
dialogue and cooperation in areas such as arms control
are of relevance, as are initiatives aimed at managing
cross-border movements and the social and political
impact of migration, based on the organization's
commitment to human rights and the promotion of
tolerance and non-discrimination, which are solid
foundations for lasting solutions to the critical problems
affecting the international community.

are of relevance, as are initiatives aimed at managing
cross-border movements and the social and political
impact of migration, based on the organization's

tolerance and non-discrimination,"]

In addition, the organization's efforts to strengthen

We welcome

conference on those issues later this year in Berlin.

Full_Sentence:
With regard to specific country situations, we praise
the OSCE's active support to the current negotiations
and mechanisms for solving conflicts in Nagorno
Karabakh and to the Transnistria talks on Georgia,
as well as its fundamental role in the stabilization of
Kosovo and in monitoring the Minsk agreement on

the OSCE's active support to the current negotiations
and mechanisms for solving conflicts in Nagorno
Karabakh and to the Transnistria talks on Georgia,

eastern Ukraine."]

Full_Sentence:
Angola values with great appreciation the contribution
of regional and subregional organizations to the
maintenance of international peace and security.
Component: [3964, 'Angola values with great appreciation the contribution\nof regional and subregional organizations to the\nmaintenance of international peace and security.']

Full_Sentence:
They
play a key role in strengthening the multilateral system
and complement the work of the United Nations through
the specific knowledge of their respective regions,
particularly with regard to the root causes of conflict.
Component:
[3965, 'They
play a key role in strengthening the multilateral system
and complement the work of the United Nations through
the specific knowledge of their respective regions,
particularly with regard to the root causes of conflict.']

Full_Sentence:
Finally, we would like to stress the importance
of dialogue between the Security Council and the

management and tackling issues that are threats to

of dialogue between the Security Council and the

and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE).

to his briefing.

the priorities defined by the German chairmanship
for enhancing dialogue, rebuilding mutual trust
and restoring security.

commends the OSCE for its efforts and welcomes
the priorities defined by the German chairmanship
for enhancing dialogue, rebuilding mutual trust
and restoring security.']

continue to play its constructive role in maintaining
regional peace, security and stability.
Component: [3968, 'We hope that the OSCE shall\ncontinue to play its constructive role in maintaining\nregional peace, security and stability.']

Full_Sentence:
China consistently advocates for political solutions

negotiation, and supports regional and subregional
organizations in conducting preventive diplomacy,
defusing differences and settling conflicts by
peaceful means so as to contribute to the promotion of
regional peace and security.

negotiation, and supports regional and subregional

defusing differences and settling conflicts by

The activities of regional
organizations should conform to the principles and
purposes of the Charter of the United Nations, in
particular the principle of respect for the sovereignty,
independence and territorial integrity of all countries.

[3970, 'The activities of regional
organizations should conform to the principles and
purposes of the Charter of the United Nations, in
particular the principle of respect for the sovereignty,
independence and territorial integrity of all countries.']

The Security Council and regional and subregional

Component: [3971, 'The Security Council and regional and subregional\norganizations have their respective advantages in\nmaintaining international peace and security.']

The
United Nations and the Security Council should, in
accordance with the provisions of the Charter of the
United Nations, continue to deepen cooperation with

uphold the Charter and the basic principles guiding

[3972, 'The

The OSCE is an important

Full_Sentence:
We support the Security
Council's engagement in efficient and practical

peace and security.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
The overall situation in eastern Ukraine is relatively
calm.
Component: [3974, 'The overall situation in eastern Ukraine is relatively\ncalm.']

Full_Sentence:
All relevant parties, including the OSCE, have
made positive efforts in this process.
Component: [3975, 'All relevant parties, including the OSCE, have\nmade positive efforts in this process.']

Full_Sentence:
A comprehensive
settlement of the Ukraine issue must follow the general
direction of a political solution, taking fully into

of all regions and ethnic groups within Ukraine, while

relevant parties.

settlement of the Ukraine issue must follow the general

China supports all relevant parties

Component:
[3977, 'China supports all relevant parties
in fully implementing the Minsk agreement, as called
for in resolution 2202 (2015), and in continuously
advancing a political solution to the Ukraine issue.']

Full_Sentence:
The

and Minsk mediation mechanisms to play their full

Component:
[3978, 'The
international community should enable the Normandy

Full_Sentence:
Mr. Churkin (Russian Federation) (spoke in Russian): We are pleased to welcome to the Security
Council the Vice-Chancellor and Minister for Foreign
Affairs of Germany, Frank-Walter Steinmeier, in his
capacity as Chairperson-in-Office of the Organization
for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE).
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We
thank him for his substantive briefing.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We have consistently stood for developing and
improving cooperation between the United Nations
and regional and subregional mechanisms on the
basis of the Charter of the United Nations, first and
foremost Chapter VIII.
Component:
[3979, 'We have consistently stood for developing and
improving cooperation between the United Nations
and regional and subregional mechanisms on the
basis of the Charter of the United Nations, first and
foremost Chapter VIII.']

It is on this very foundation
that cooperation between the United Nations and the
OSCE should be based.
Component: [3980, 'It is on this very foundation\nthat cooperation between the United Nations and the\nOSCE should be based.']

Full_Sentence:
Cooperation between the two
organizations is regular and multilateral in nature,
covering all dimensions of security, as well as cross-
dimensional issues.
Component:
[3981, 'Cooperation between the two
organizations is regular and multilateral in nature,
covering all dimensions of security, as well as cross-
dimensional issues.']

Full_Sentence:
We share the emphasis of the German chairmanship

has a solid foundation in the form of the genuine
equality of all States parties and a broad-based agenda,
which reflects the interests of all.
Component:
[3982, 'We share the emphasis of the German chairmanship
on the "all-weather" dialogue, for which the OSCE

As is well known,
in the OSCE not a single State or bloc of States can
freeze matters of common interest and of paramount
importance for European security.
Component: [3983, 'in the OSCE not a single State or bloc of States can\nfreeze matters of common interest and of paramount\nimportance for European security.']

Full_Sentence:
There are collective
means of crisis management, which enjoy high
credibility in the region.
Component: [3984, 'There are collective\nmeans of crisis management, which enjoy high\ncredibility in the region.']

Full_Sentence:
That must remain the OSCE's
philosophy of dialogue in the future.
Component: [3985, "That must remain the OSCE's\nphilosophy of dialogue in the future."]

Full_Sentence:
The OSCE has entered into its fifth decade
of existence, having accumulated considerable
international experience and created its own
mechanisms.

[3986, 'The OSCE has entered into its fifth decade
of existence, having accumulated considerable
international experience and created its own
mechanisms.']

Full_Sentence:
Unfortunately, the ideals that were at the

commitments apply equally and without exception to
each participating State and that we are accountable to
our citizens and responsible to each other for their full
implementation.

Full_Sentence:
Mr. Iliichev (Russian Federation) (spoke in Russian): We thank the Chairperson-in-Office of the
Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe
(OSCE), the Federal Minister for Europe, Integration
and Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Austria,
Mr. Kurz, for his comprehensive briefing.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We should like to see growing cooperation between
the United Nations and regional and subregional
organizations on the basis of the Charter of the United
Nations, especially its Chapter VIII.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
Such cooperation
must be regular and multifaceted, encompassing all
dimensions of security.
Component: [4180, 'Such cooperation\nmust be regular and multifaceted, encompassing all\ndimensions of security.']

Full_Sentence:
The OSCE is designed to assist
United Nations mechanisms in the area of their purview
within the framework of its mandate.
Component: [4181, 'The OSCE is designed to assist\nUnited Nations mechanisms in the area of their purview\nwithin the framework of its mandate.']

Full_Sentence:
It is important
to take into account the comparative advantages of
the two organizations and to avoid duplication and the
waste of resources.
Component:
[4182, 'It is important
to take into account the comparative advantages of
the two organizations and to avoid duplication and the
waste of resources.']

Full_Sentence:
We should like to see constructive
cooperation with the Austrian chairmanship of
the OSCE and we share its key priorities, aimed at
conflict resolution, combatting radicalization and
extremism, the restoration of trust among States, and
the strengthening of the institutional foundation of the
Organization.
Component:
[4183, 'we share its key priorities, aimed at
conflict resolution, combatting radicalization and
extremism, the restoration of trust among States, and
the strengthening of the institutional foundation of the
Organization.']

Full_Sentence:
The OSCE must strive to carry out those functions
for which it was created, serving as a platform for
equitable dialogue and collective decision-making
on security issues.
Component:
[4184, 'The OSCE must strive to carry out those functions
for which it was created, serving as a platform for
equitable dialogue and collective decision-making
on security issues.']

Full_Sentence:
Its focus should be on the fight
against terrorism, drug trafficking and cyberthreats;
the harmonization of integration processes; support
for traditional values and the protection of the rights of
national minorities; combatting neo-Nazism; reform of
the OSCE, including the development of its charter; and
the organization of the electoral monitoring work of the
Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights.
Component:
[4185, 'Its focus should be on the fight
against terrorism, drug trafficking and cyberthreats;
the harmonization of integration processes; support
for traditional values and the protection of the rights of
national minorities; combatting neo-Nazism; reform of
the OSCE, including the development of its charter; and
the organization of the electoral monitoring work of the
Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights.']

Full_Sentence: We are ready to contribute to that.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We see the greatest potential in combating
transnational threats, particularly in the context of the
immigration crisis, the fight against human trafficking,
xenophobia and discrimination, and especially in
the protection of the rights of national, religious and
linguistic minorities.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We have noted the evolution of the cooperation
between the United Nations and the OSCE, with
major collaboration between the OSCE secretariat's
Transnational Threats Department and the United
Nations Office on Drugs and Crime in combating
trafficking in drugs and small arms, terrorism,
organized crime, corruption and money-laundering,
as well as in the areas of combating human trafficking
and illegal migration.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
The OSCE's Ministerial Council
meetings in Basel in 2014 and Belgrade in 2015 adopted
declarations on the issue of cooperation between the
two organizations, strengthening the OSCE's role in
implementing important United Nations decisions,
in particular the Security Council's anti-terrorism
resolutions 2170 (2014), 2178 (2014), 2199 (2015) and
2249 (2015).
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
Last summer in Kaliningrad, Russia's
Ministry of Foreign Affairs, together with the
OSCE's Conflict Prevention Centre and the United
Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs, organized a
seminar for OSCE participating States' focal points on
implementing resolution 1540 (2004).
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
In the area of international security information, the
OSCE complements the global United Nations efforts
to develop confidence-building measures through the
use of information and communications technologies.
Component:
[4186, 'In the area of international security information, the
OSCE complements the global United Nations efforts
to develop confidence-building measures through the
use of information and communications technologies.']

Full_Sentence:

Full_Sentence:
We take a generally positive

the OSCE in the field, for example, through the OSCE
Mission in Kosovo.
Component:
[4187, 'We take a generally positive
view of cooperation between the United Nations and
the OSCE in the field, for example, through the OSCE

We support

continuing efforts to help settle regional conflicts, and

It is to be hoped that 2017 can bring peace and a

Full_Sentence:

All of that

In that regard, we believe that we have a proven and

We do not see

We hope that the Austrian

Full_Sentence:
While the OSCE has sufficient resources in the area

the parties and respect for their interests, and within
existing formats.

cautiously in this sensitive and delicate process and to

Full_Sentence:
In conclusion, I would like to emphasize that Russia

[4200, 'Russia
considers the OSCE to be an important mechanism

We believe firmly that in order to

[4201, "We believe firmly that in order to
improve the OSCE's relevance it is essential to clearly

welcome Foreign Minister Kurz to the Security Council
and thank him for his briefing today.

Full_Sentence:
His chairmanship

Europe (OSCE), together with Austria's hosting of the
OSCE, as well as parts ofthe United Nations, showsjust
how central his country is to international cooperation
and the rule-based system.

Full_Sentence:
Sadly, as we heard here yesterday (see S/PV.7886),
the rule-based system is under threat.
Component: [4202, 'the rule-based system is under threat.']

Full_Sentence:
It is a threat
that we talk about often in this Chamber, but to the
residents of cities such as Marinka, in Ukraine, that
threat is a horrifying daily reality.
Component:
[4203, 'It is a threat
that we talk about often in this Chamber, but to the
residents of cities such as Marinka, in Ukraine, that
threat is a horrifying daily reality.']

Full_Sentence:
For the past three
years, the people there have lived in fear, subject to the
daily unrelenting dangers that have become the norm
on the front line in eastern Ukraine.
Component:
[4204, 'For the past three
years, the people there have lived in fear, subject to the
daily unrelenting dangers that have become the norm
on the front line in eastern Ukraine.']

Full_Sentence:
Residents there

scramble for shelter.
Component: [4205, 'Residents there\nspeak of daily sniper fire and shelling, and the daily\nscramble for shelter.']

Full_Sentence:
For nearly three years, they have
survived Without gas supplies in the face of plummeting
temperatures every winter.
Component: [4206, 'For nearly three years, they have\nsurvived Without gas supplies in the face of plummeting\ntemperatures every winter.']

Those are the consequences

Full_Sentence:
That is what happens when the rule-based system
is attacked.

Full_Sentence:
We cannot allow it to become the new
normal, and we must use all the tools at our disposal
in response.
Component: [4209, 'We cannot allow it to become the new\nnormal, and we must use all the tools at our disposal\nin response.']

Full_Sentence:
The OSCE has a critical role to play,
and I would particularly like to commend the role of
the OSCE's Special Monitoring Mission in Ukraine,
working tirelessly under the able direction of Chief

Full_Sentence:
It is thanks to the bravery of the

Full_Sentence:
It is unacceptable that the Mission continues to

Such
actions, so often perpetrated by the separatists, only

[4211, 'Such
actions, so often perpetrated by the separatists, only
fuel suspicions that they are concealing activity that is

Full_Sentence:
I hope, therefore,
that we can all be clear today that aggression towards

that we can all be clear today that aggression towards

Full_Sentence:
As we heard yesterday, the long-term solution to
the situation in eastern Ukraine requires Russia to end
its destabilizing activities in the region, comply with its
commitments under the Minsk agreements, withdraw its
weapons and personnel, use its considerable influence
over the separatists to bring an end to the killing and
return Crimea to its rightful place as part of Ukraine.

[4213, 'the long-term solution to
the situation in eastern Ukraine requires Russia to end
its destabilizing activities in the region, comply with its
commitments under the Minsk agreements, withdraw its
weapons and personnel, use its considerable influence
over the separatists to bring an end to the killing and
return Crimea to its rightful place as part of Ukraine.']

Full_Sentence:
That is the only meaningful path to long-term peace
in Ukraine, and until it is taken, the sanctions against
Russia must remain in place.

Beyond Ukraine, we should not lose sight of the

fundamental rights and freedoms.

vital role that the OSCE plays in risk reduction in the

We support the Chairperson-in-Office's

If the OSCE is to respond to those and other

One

way to do that is through strong appointments, and I

We are also

pleased that our Ambassador to the OSCE is chairing

In conclusion, events in eastern Ukraine have

The world today is filled with various types of

Full_Sentence:
Guadey (Ethiopia): I wish to start by
congratulating His Excellency Mr. Sebastian Kurz, the
Minister for Foreign Affairs ofAustria, on his becoming
Chairperson-in-Office of the Organization for Security
and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE).
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
I would also like to
thank him for his comprehensive briefing.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
We welcome the significant contribution that
the OSCE continues to make in supporting the
maintenance of international peace and security as
one of the largest regional security organizations.
Component:
[4279, 'We welcome the significant contribution that
the OSCE continues to make in supporting the
maintenance of international peace and security as
one of the largest regional security organizations.']

Full_Sentence:
Its
comprehensive approach to security, which includes the
political, military, economic, environmental and human
dimensions, is in line with the new global paradigm
aimed at ensuring sustainable peace and development.
Component:
[4280, 'Its
comprehensive approach to security, which includes the
political, military, economic, environmental and human
dimensions, is in line with the new global paradigm
aimed at ensuring sustainable peace and development.']

Full_Sentence:
In that connection, we take note ofthe organization's
efforts in conflict prevention and resolution as well
as post-conflict reconstruction and peacebuilding.

Full_Sentence:
Particularly, we appreciate the important role that
the OSCE is playing in the efforts to resolve the
protracted and new conflicts in South-Eastern Europe,
Eastern Europe, the South Caucasus and Central
Asia, in cooperation with the United Nations and the
European Union.

the OSCE is playing in the efforts to resolve the

Asia, in cooperation with the United Nations and the
European Union']

Full_Sentence:
As we said yesterday during our debate on conflicts
in Europe (see S/PV.7886), dialogue and negotiation
remain the only way to find a durable and diplomatic
solution to some of those conflicts and extremely
delicate issues of peace and security affecting States
members of the OSCE.
Component:
[4283, 'dialogue and negotiation
remain the only way to find a durable and diplomatic
solution to some of those conflicts and extremely
delicate issues of peace and security affecting States
members of the OSCE.']

We cannot overemphasize the

and implemented.

[4284, 'We cannot overemphasize the
need for the political will and commitment ofthe parties

confidence between and among the parties is also very
critical to making tangible progress.

We are pleased to

alternative channels of communication to improve

threats of terrorism and violent extremism pose a

States.

important role in preventing and combating terrorism

I welcome the presence of Mr. Sebastian Kurz, the
Austrian Minister for Europe, Integration and Foreign
Affairs, at the Security Council table and congratulate
his country on its assumption of the chairmanship
of the Organization for Security and Cooperation
in Europe (OSCE) for this year.
Component: non-arg

Full_Sentence:
In the challenging
strategic environment that Europe is facing today,
Austria knows that it can count on our full support to
implement its programme of work, which is centred
appropriately on the themes of security, conflict
resolution and combating radicalization and terrorism.

The OSCE has been up to the

France is also

determined, in conjunction with its German partners, to

It is essential that they be

Component:
[4552, 'China supports enhancing the cooperation between
the United Nations and regional and subregional
organizations, in accordance with Chapter VIII of the
Charter of the United Nations, with the aim of jointly
maintaining international peace and security.']

Full_Sentence:
The
cooperation between the United Nations and regional
and subregional organizations should firmly uphold the
purposes and principles of the Charter of the United
Nations while working diligently to address hot-spot
issues through dialogue and consultation and engaging
actively in preventive diplomacy with the aim of
defusing and resolving disputes peacefully.

Full_Sentence:
The OSCE is an important partner of the United
Nations.
Component: [4554, 'The OSCE is an important partner of the United\nNations.']

Full_Sentence:
In recent years it has been actively engaged in
preventive diplomacy, promoting security and mutual
trust among countries in the region and mediating
regional disputes, efforts that China appreciates and
applauds.

Full_Sentence:
We welcome Italy's decision to designate
dialogue, ownership and responsibility as its working
motto during its chairship-in-office, and to respond
actively to terrorism, illicit smuggling, transnational
crimes and refugee crises, among other challenges.

[4556, "We welcome Italy's decision to designate

actively to terrorism, illicit smuggling, transnational
crimes and refugee crises, among other challenges."]

Full_Sentence:
China supports practical and effective cooperation
between the Security Council and the OSCE in the
areas of peace and security, and we are eager to see the
OSCE continue to play an active and constructive role
in upholding regional peace, security and stability.
Component:
[4557, 'China supports practical and effective cooperation
between the Security Council and the OSCE in the
areas of peace and security, and we are eager to see the
OSCE continue to play an active and constructive role
in upholding regional peace, security and stability.']

Full_Sentence:
We welcome all the positive efforts being made by
all the parties concerned, including the OSCE, to find a
peaceful solution to the Ukrainian issue.
Component: [4558, 'We welcome all the positive efforts being made by\nall the parties concerned, including the OSCE, to find a\npeaceful solution to the Ukrainian issue.']

Full_Sentence:
We hope that
all the parties concerned will work to fully implement
the relevant Security Council resolutions and the Minsk
agreements, with the aim of reaching a comprehensive,
lasting and balanced solution to the question of Ukraine
through dialogue and consultation.
Component:
[4559, 'We hope that
all the parties concerned will work to fully implement
the relevant Security Council resolutions and the Minsk
agreements, with the aim of reaching a comprehensive,
lasting and balanced solution to the question of Ukraine
through dialogue and consultation.']

Full_Sentence:
The international
community should continue to support the diplomatic
efforts of all the parties concerned to arrive at a political
settlement of the Ukrainian issue so as to collectively
restore peace, stability and development in Ukraine as
soon as possible.
